title: Chinese Embassy grants US$10,000 as relief aid to flood victims in Vietnam
description: On October 8, 2010, the Chinese Embassy in Vietnam donated US$10,000 for flood relief. The monetary aid was accepted by a representative of the Vietnam Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Embassy grants US$10,000 as relief aid to flood victims in Vietnam

# Description
On October 8, 2010, the Chinese Embassy in Vietnam donated US$10,000 for flood relief. The monetary aid was accepted by a representative of the Vietnam Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
justification: Monetary aid for flood relief with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Emergency relief aid, no infrastructure or energy components

title: China Eximbank provides $300 million preferential buyer's credit loan for 1244MW Vinh Tan 2 Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#65949, #65950)
description: On September 7, 2009, China Eximbank and the Vietnam Ministry of Finance signed preferential buyer's credit (PBC) loan framework agreement for the the 1244MW Vinh Tan 2 Coal-Fired Power Plant Construction Project. Then, on December 17, 2010, China Eximbank and Vietnam Electricity (EVN) — a state-owned power company — signed three loan agreements for this project:   (1) RMB 600 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement with a 17-year maturity (captured via Project ID#65949). This loan matures in 2027.  (2) $300 million preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement with a 17-year maturity (captured via Project ID#35236). This loan matures in 2027.  (3) $695 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement with an 18-year maturity (captured via Project ID#65950). This loan matures in 2028.   The proceeds of these loans were on-lent by EVN — via 3 separate loans: 04/HĐCVL/EXIMBANK-EVN-G3 (KV 01), 04/HĐCVL/EXIMBANK-EVN-G3 (KV 02), and 04/HĐCVL/EXIMBANK-EVN-G3 (KV 03) — to Power Generation Corporation 3 (EVNGENCO 3), a wholly owned subsidiary of EVN. The proceeds from these three loans were to be used by the ultimate borrower to cover 85% of the cost ($1.08 billion) of a $1.265 billion EPC contract signed on October 23, 2009 between EVN and Shanghai Electric Group Company Limited. EVN provided counterpart financing for the remaining 15%.   The purpose of the project was to construct a 1244MW coal-fired power plant — with two, 622MW power generation units (Unit 1 and Unit 2) —  in Bắc Lũng commune, Lục Nam district, and Bắc Giang province. Shanghai Electric Group Company Limited was the EPC contractor responsible for implementation.  Power Construction Consulting Joint Stock Company 2 (PECC2) was the contractor responsible for construction supervision. Construction began on August 8, 2010. Units 1 and 2 were put into operation of commercial operation on January 30, 2015 and March 21, 2015, respectively. A formal project completion ceremony took place on November 7, 2020.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the 2x622MW Vinh Tan 2 Thermal Power Plant Project, the Vinh Tan 2 Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant Project, or the Vinh Tan II Coal-Fired Thermal Power Plant Project. The Chinese project title is 署越南永新火电项目 or 越南永新燃煤电厂二期项目. The Vietnamese project title is Nhà máy Nhiệt điện Vĩnh Tân 2 or Dự án Nhà máy nhiệt điện Vĩnh Tân 2 or NMNĐ Vĩnh Tân 2. 2. Neither the RMB 600 million China Eximbank GCL nor the $695 million China Eximbank BCL that supported this project are included in the Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title

# Description

title: China Development Bank provides $100 million loan to Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam (BIDV) for on-lending purposes
description: In 2010, China Development Bank (CDB) provided a $100 million loan to Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam (BIDV)— a state-owned bank— for on-lending purposes. The loan carried a 3-year maturity but no additional borrowing terms are available.   The proceeds of the loan were to be used by BIDV to on-lend in support of economic development projects (power, telecommunication, agricultural, transport, construction) in Vietnam. In 2015, CDB provided another loan to BIDV for the same purpose (see Project #64487).
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
China Development Bank provides $100 million loan to Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam (BIDV) for on-lending purposes

# Description
In 2010, China Development Bank (CDB) provided a $100 million loan to Bank for Investment and Development of Vietnam (BIDV)— a state-owned bank— for on-lending purposes. The loan carried a 3-year maturity but no additional borrowing terms are available.   The proceeds of the loan were to be used by BIDV to on-lend in support of economic development projects (power, telecommunication, agricultural, transport, construction) in Vietnam. In 2015, CDB provided another loan to BIDV for the same purpose (see Project #64487).
justification: Project involves financial services with no direct environmental impact or energy transition implications
evidence: Loan provided for on-lending purposes to support various economic development projects without specific environmental focus

title: CDB provides $1.05 billion loan to Vietnam Oil and Gas Group (Petrovietnam) for unspecified purposes.
description: In 2010, China Development and Vietnam Oil and Gas Group (Petrovietnam) — a state-owned oil and gas company in Vietnam — signed a $1.05 billion loan agreement for unspecified purposes. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. AidData independently confirmed the existence of this loan agreement via correspondence with a Beijing-based law firm that served as an adviser on the transaction.

title: Chinese embassy grants sports goods to Yemen Table Tennis Association
description: On October 11th, 2010, the Chinese Embassy in Yemen donated sporting goods of unspecified value to the Yemen Table Tennis Association. This project is complete.

title: Chinese medical team conducts cataract surgeries in Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (Linked to Project ID#65191)
description: From January 17 to 18, 2010, China’s Liaoning Department of Health dispatch a medical team to Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (مستشفى الثوره تعز) to train 20 Yemeni ophthalmologists. They conducted 50 cataract surgeries. This project was completed.   On January 18, 2010, the team also donated ophthalmic and other medical equipment worth RMB 400,000 to the Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (see Project ID#65191).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese medical team conducts cataract surgeries in Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (Linked to Project ID#65191)

# Description
From January 17 to 18, 2010, China’s Liaoning Department of Health dispatch a medical team to Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (مستشفى الثوره تعز) to train 20 Yemeni ophthalmologists. They conducted 50 cataract surgeries. This project was completed.   On January 18, 2010, the team also donated ophthalmic and other medical equipment worth RMB 400,000 to the Taiz Revolutionary Hospital (see Project ID#65191).
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services and medical training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cataract surgeries, medical training, donation of medical equipment

title: Chinese Ministry of Education donates instructional equipment to Yemeni-Chinese Institute for Applied and Technical Sciences
description: On June 5, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Yemen, on behalf of the Chinese Ministry of Education, donated computers and other instructional equipment to the Yemeni-Chinese Institute for Applied and Technical Sciences (المعهد اليمني الصيني) in the capital city of Sana’a. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
staff_comments: This school was originally constructed with Chinese Government assistance in the 1960s and established in 1970. The Chinese Government refers to it as China’s ‘first foreign-aided secondary technical school.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Ministry of Education donates instructional equipment to Yemeni-Chinese Institute for Applied and Technical Sciences

# Description
On June 5, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Yemen, on behalf of the Chinese Ministry of Education, donated computers and other instructional equipment to the Yemeni-Chinese Institute for Applied and Technical Sciences (المعهد اليمني الصيني) in the capital city of Sana’a. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on educational equipment donation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of computers and instructional equipment to educational institution
